properties.description: The number of objects in the collection.
properties.name: length

parameters.description: Initial values for properties of the new GradientStop (Optional)
parameters.name: withProperties

methods.description: Displays the number of elements in the GradientStop.
methods.name: count

methods.description: Returns the GradientStop with the specified index or name.

parameters.description: The index or name. Can accept: Long Integer or String.
parameters.name: index

methods.name: item

methods.description: Returns the GradientStops within the specified range.

parameters.description: The GradientStop, index, or name at the beginning of the range. Can accept: GradientStop, Long Integer or String.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: The GradientStop, index, or name at the end of the range. Can accept: GradientStop, Long Integer or String.
parameters.name: to

methods.name: itemByRange

methods.description: Returns the first GradientStop in the collection.
methods.name: firstItem

methods.description: Returns the last GradientStop in the collection.
methods.name: lastItem

methods.description: Returns the middle GradientStop in the collection.
methods.name: middleItem

methods.description: Returns the GradientStop with the index previous to the specified index.

parameters.description: The index of the GradientStop that follows the desired GradientStop.
parameters.name: obj

methods.name: previousItem

methods.description: Returns the GradientStop whose index follows the specified GradientStop in the collection.

parameters.description: The GradientStop whose index comes before the desired GradientStop.
parameters.name: obj

methods.name: nextItem

methods.description: Returns any GradientStop in the collection.
methods.name: anyItem

methods.description: Returns every GradientStop in the collection.
methods.name: everyItem

methods.description: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the GradientStop.
methods.name: toSource

methods.description: Returns the GradientStop with the specified index.
